e4: Changing to a new policy fosters accuracy and conforms with ethical standards within financial reporting, mitigating legal risks and aligning with transparency expectations from informed investors. Although requiring strategic communication to prevent initial misunderstandings, this approach substantiates ABC’s reputability by presenting true earnings, particularly advantageous when engaging diverse investor transitions, inclusive of market-driven inhibiting investigations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should uphold transparency, accuracy, and consistency, ensuring stakeholders can trust the financial information. It must conform to regulatory standards and prevent misleading conclusions by any investor group. Clear communication when adjustments or policy changes occur is essential to maintain investor confidence and market fairness.
e6: Would the management team have a defined communication plan ready to inform investors comprehensively about the transition to the new unbiased EPS reporting policy to mitigate confusion, potentially creating resolving policy-based ambiguity? Additionally, how will strategies brief to anchor views harmonious long-term impact inaccurately not aligning assumptions post-policy adoption?
